column3: Merged via 6abf6eb7bb777a5c4f22e9db6d4544281277378f (needed trivial rebase change in rpc-tests.py)\n
Nit: Shouldn't the `print` appear in front of `assert`? So when it fails, we know where it did (Not just by line number)?\n
Long overdue to have this moved to the test framework. Thanks!\n

Well then it would be printing something incorrect if the assertion failed.  I guess I could add a different print statement above the asserts, but not sure it's worth it?  If the assertion fails I think the stack trace is informative enough, and I don't think the style here is inconsistent with the rest of the tests.\n

Where would you put a comment, when you had put one? Then just replace the `#` with `print` and you get in L109:

`print "Assert that prioritised transaction was mined"`

> rest of the tests

I see no reason to do this. You could as well just remove the `print` completely.
